subject: Design
title: The Coca-Cola Bottle: Recognizable in the Dark
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Coca-Cola Bottle: Recognizable in the Dark.

hook.text: Coca-Cola's 1915 brief was: design a bottle recognizable by touch in the dark or shattered on the ground.

buildup.text: Root Glass Company designed the contour bottle inspired by cocoa pod illustrations in an encyclopedia.

discovery.text: The fluted shape, narrow waist, and thick glass made it unmistakable among competitors.

twist.text: They used cocoa pods by mistake â€” confusing coca (the plant) with cocoa. An error created an icon.

climax.text: The Coca-Cola bottle is one of the most recognized objects on Earth, all from one clear design brief.

punchline.text: The world's most iconic bottle was designed from the wrong plant.

quiz.question: What was unique about Coca-Cola's design brief?
options: Recognizable by touch in the dark
